intro: Pedicularis rhinanthoides subsp. labellata, commonly known as the yellow labellate lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which are typically borne on slender, erect stems. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The species is notable for its distinctive lip-shaped petals and its role in supporting pollinators in its native environment.
